meanings.definition: The branch of astronomy that involves precise measurements of the positions and movements of stars and other celestial bodies.
meanings.sent1: Astrometry helps scientists study how stars move in the sky.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use astrometry to measure the exact locations of stars in space.
meanings.sent3: The astrometry research team had a starry-eyed view of their work.
meanings.sent4: In the vast universe, astrometry acts as a celestial GPS for astronomers.
meanings.sent5: The precision of astrometry is crucial for mapping out the cosmos.

meanings.definition: The practice of measuring the positions and distances of stars and other celestial objects for the purpose of determining their motions and properties.
meanings.sent1: Astrometry allows astronomers to track the movements of distant stars.
meanings.sent2: The astrometry data revealed the exact distances between celestial bodies.
meanings.sent3: During the astrometry experiment, the stars seemed to play hide and seek.
meanings.sent4: The beauty of astrometry lies in unraveling the secrets of the night sky.
meanings.sent5: Through astrometry, astronomers unlock the mysteries of the universe.
